snippet: When they convened in 1968 in Chicago, the Democrats, like the nation, were deeply divided. Outside the convention, protests got out of hand and the police came down hard - Barton Silverman, a Times photographer, captured it all, including an arrest.
abstract: When they convened in 1968 in Chicago, the Democrats, like the nation, were deeply divided. Outside the convention, protests got out of hand and the police came down hard - Barton Silverman, a Times photographer, captured it all, including an arrest.

headline.main: On the Lens Blog: Dodging the Police and Tear Gas at the 1968 Democratic Convention
